page.title: 14THE FARMING YEAR
page.content: In Autumn on any given day four tractors would be at work in varous fields,one pulling a culitivator to break up the soil to nine inches deep, the second breaking it down more deeply, the third making the sowing bed and the fourth sowing the Winter barley. Other Autumn jobs are fencing and final spraying. In Winter the cattle have to be fed and bedded up, yards cleaned and any concreting done.In Spring fields are harrowed over,fertilized and sown.The crops sprout in ten days and the second spraying is done.In Summer the bulk of the crops are sprayed again.Silage is made in June.July is harvest time.The combine is started up at ten a.m when the dew has dried and then kept going until nine p.m. Paper work is done in the evenings throughout the year.
